intro: Struthanthus radicans, commonly known as the trailing struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Struthanthus radicans is often found in rocky soils and is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
